framework.name: NIST 800-53 Rev 5
framework.description: Security and Privacy Controls for Information Systems and Organisations. NIST Special Publication 800-53 provides a catalogue of security and privacy controls for all US federal information systems.

controls.name: Account Management
controls.description: Manage system accounts, group memberships, privileges, credentials, and access authorisations.

controls.name: Access Enforcement
controls.description: Enforce approved authorisations for logical access to information and system resources.

controls.name: Information Flow Enforcement
controls.description: Enforce approved authorisations for controlling the flow of information within the system and between systems.

controls.name: Separation of Duties
controls.description: Separate duties of individuals to reduce risk of malevolent activity.

controls.name: Least Privilege
controls.description: Employ the principle of least privilege, allowing only authorised accesses for users necessary to accomplish assigned tasks.

controls.name: Unsuccessful Logon Attempts
controls.description: Enforce a limit of consecutive invalid logon attempts by a user and take action when the maximum is exceeded.

controls.name: Remote Access
controls.description: Establish usage restrictions and implementation guidance for each type of remote access allowed.

controls.name: Event Logging
controls.description: Identify the types of events that the system is capable of logging in support of the audit function.

controls.name: Content of Audit Records
controls.description: Ensure that audit records contain information that establishes what occurred, when, where, the source, and the outcome.

controls.name: Audit Record Review, Analysis, and Reporting
controls.description: Review and analyse system audit records for indications of inappropriate or unusual activity.

controls.name: Protection of Audit Information
controls.description: Protect audit information and audit logging tools from unauthorised access, modification, and deletion.

controls.name: Audit Record Generation
controls.description: Provide audit record generation capability for the event types the system is capable of auditing.

controls.name: Baseline Configuration
controls.description: Develop, document, and maintain a current baseline configuration of the system.

controls.name: Configuration Change Control
controls.description: Determine and document the types of changes to the system that are configuration-controlled.

controls.name: Configuration Settings
controls.description: Establish and document configuration settings for components within the system.

controls.name: Least Functionality
controls.description: Configure the system to provide only essential capabilities and prohibit or restrict use of non-essential functions.

controls.name: Identification and Authentication (Organisational Users)
controls.description: Uniquely identify and authenticate organisational users and associate that unique identification with processes acting on behalf of those users.

controls.name: Identifier Management
controls.description: Manage system identifiers for users and devices by receiving authorisation and assigning unique identifiers.

controls.name: Authenticator Management
controls.description: Manage system authenticators by verifying the identity of the individual receiving the authenticator.

controls.name: Identification and Authentication (Non-Organisational Users)
controls.description: Uniquely identify and authenticate non-organisational users or processes acting on behalf of non-organisational users.

controls.name: Incident Handling
controls.description: Implement an incident handling capability that includes preparation, detection, analysis, containment, eradication, and recovery.

controls.name: Incident Monitoring
controls.description: Track and document system security and privacy incidents.

controls.name: Information in Shared System Resources
controls.description: Prevent unauthorised and unintended information transfer via shared system resources.

controls.name: Boundary Protection
controls.description: Monitor and control communications at the external managed interfaces to the system and at key internal managed interfaces.

controls.name: Transmission Confidentiality and Integrity
controls.description: Protect the confidentiality and integrity of transmitted information.

controls.name: Cryptographic Key Establishment and Management
controls.description: Establish and manage cryptographic keys when cryptography is employed within the system.

controls.name: Session Authenticity
controls.description: Protect the authenticity of communications sessions.

controls.name: Malicious Code Protection
controls.description: Implement malicious code protection mechanisms at system entry and exit points to detect and eradicate malicious code.

controls.name: System Monitoring
controls.description: Monitor the system to detect attacks, indicators of potential attacks, and unauthorised connections.

controls.name: Security Alerts, Advisories, and Directives
controls.description: Receive system security alerts, advisories, and directives from external organisations on an ongoing basis.

controls.name: Software, Firmware, and Information Integrity
controls.description: Employ integrity verification tools to detect unauthorised changes to software, firmware, and information.

controls.name: Information Input Validation
controls.description: Check the validity of information inputs.

controls.name: Vulnerability Monitoring and Scanning
controls.description: Monitor and scan for vulnerabilities in the system and hosted applications.

controls.name: Continuous Monitoring
controls.description: Develop a system-level continuous monitoring strategy and implement continuous monitoring.
